comments:
This course is an introduction to basic principles of fluid mechanics and of energy and mass transport with emphasis on applications to living systems and biomedical devices.

Although this course is “difficult,” students agreed that it was \"one of the best classes I have taken.\" However, students noted that there were “no real life applications;” and that the course was “all theoretical.”

As one student wrote, “Dr. Schotland is a fantastic teacher and a very helpful individual.” Dr. Schotland is also “always willing to answer questions.” Students had mixed feelings about Dr. Schotland’s tendency to “present most but not all steps” when teaching.

There is a consensus among students that the text “was not helpful.” There are weekly quizzes, which “reinforced the material and forced [students] to study.” The midterm and final were described as “very fair.” The Prerequisites for this course are MATH 241 or equivalent and PHYS 140 or 150.
